page.title: 14It's not Cricket (I think)
page.content: I play football, a very popular game in our country. There are four leagues. Leagues are sorts of teams. The teams score points: three if you win, one if you draw and none if you lose. The team with the most points wins. Another popular sport is rugby: instead of always kicking the ball, as in football, a player can run with it to the other end of the grass. A football is round but a rugby ball is oval. To score in football the ball has to be kicked through the goal, but in rugby the goal is made of wood shaped like a letter "H". In rugby the captain throws the ball into the middle of a circle of players. The two teams dive for the ball and try to run with it to the goal at the far end of the pitch. The person with the ball throws it. John Molden
